---
title: "export.json"
---

## High-level description
This JSON file represents a configuration for feature flags and user segments in a feature management system. It defines a namespace, two feature flags with different types and rules, and two user segments with various constraints.

## Code Structure
The JSON structure consists of a root object with four main sections: version, namespace, flags, and segments. The flags and segments are arrays containing detailed configurations for each feature flag and user segment respectively.

## Symbols

### Root Object
#### Description
The root object contains the overall configuration for the feature management system.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| version | string | Version of the configuration format |
| namespace | object | Details of the namespace |
| flags | array | List of feature flag configurations |
| segments | array | List of user segment configurations |

### Namespace
#### Description
Defines the namespace for the feature flags.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the namespace |
| name | string | Display name for the namespace |
| description | string | Brief description of the namespace |

### Flags
#### Description
An array of feature flag configurations.

#### Inputs
Each flag object in the array contains:

| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the flag |
| name | string | Display name for the flag |
| type | string | Type of the flag (e.g., "VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE", "BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE") |
| description | string | Brief description of the flag |
| enabled | boolean | Whether the flag is enabled or not |
| variants | array | (For VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE) List of variants for the flag |
| rules | array | (For VARIANT_FLAG_TYPE) Rules for flag distribution |
| rollouts | array | (For BOOLEAN_FLAG_TYPE) Rollout configurations |
| metadata | object | Additional metadata for the flag |

### Segments
#### Description
An array of user segment configurations.

#### Inputs
Each segment object in the array contains:

| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| key | string | Unique identifier for the segment |
| name | string | Display name for the segment |
| match_type | string | Type of matching for the segment (e.g., "ANY_MATCH_TYPE") |
| description | string | Brief description of the segment |
| constraints | array | (Optional) List of constraints for the segment |

## Dependencies
This JSON file doesn't have any external dependencies. It's a self-contained configuration file.

## Configuration
The entire file serves as a configuration for a feature management system. Key configuration options include:

| Option | Type | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:------------|
| version | string | Specifies the version of the configuration format (currently "1.4") |
| namespace | object | Defines the namespace for the feature flags |
| flags | array | Contains the configuration for individual feature flags |
| segments | array | Contains the configuration for user segments |

## API/Interface Reference
While this is not an API definition, it does define a structure that could be used as part of an API response or configuration input. The main components are:

| Component | Description |
|:----------|:------------|
| Namespace | Defines the context for flags and segments |
| Flags | Defines feature flags with variants, rules, and rollouts |
| Segments | Defines user segments with constraints |

This structure allows for complex feature flag configurations, including variant flags with multiple options, boolean flags with rollout rules, and user segments with various constraints. It provides a flexible system for managing feature releases and user targeting in a software application.
